about.summary: Use geometric objects as matplotlib paths and patches

name: descartes
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.1.0" %}

package:
  name: descartes
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/d/descartes/descartes-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 135a502146af5ed6ff359975e2ebc5fa4b71b5432c355c2cafdc6dea1337035b

build:
  number: 3
  noarch: python
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv"

requirements:
  host:
    - python
    - pip
  run:
    - python
    - matplotlib

test:
  imports:
    - descartes

about:
  home: http://bitbucket.org/sgillies/descartes/
  # https://bitbucket.org/sgillies/descartes/issues/5/license
  license: BSD
  summary: 'Use geometric objects as matplotlib paths and patches'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ocefpaf
